page.title: 15The weeks news in St.Helens
page.content: contd Those who stay open have no qualified teaching staff on the premises. West Park school had a Gala day on June 20th and in pouring rain the football competition was won by Bleak Hill C.P. School. Two Bleak Hill C.P. School boys were selected to play cricket for Lancashire. Lady Pilkington helped repaint the "Blue Bridge" after it had been painted grey by the local authorities in error.She was also elected a vice patron of National Rose Society. She was appointed a deputy Lieutenant of Merseyside. Michael Hopkins won first prize in poetry section of national Spastics Literary Contest. Sue Pilkington a local freelance journalist had her first article printed in the TIMES
